definition: odds of success/stratagem that ensures success/to be sure of success

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute
to be assured of success

sentences.english: Night-before cramming requires playing the odds, and your best bet is on the big stuff.
sentences.chinese: 夜前惡補要有勝算，你最好的賭注應該放在重點上。

sentences.english: Coyett was now truly on his own, against impossible odds.
sentences.chinese: 揆一這一次真的只有靠自己，毫無勝算。

sentences.english: And while they often have great promise at the beginning of the season, they usually disappoint their loyal fans in the end.
sentences.chinese: 就算在球季一開始很有勝算，但最終還是讓球迷失望。

sentences.english: The odds, Si Ma Ping Bang says, are stacked against Xinhua.
sentences.chinese: 司馬平邦認爲，新華社的勝算不大。

sentences.english: The odds against this sentence having ever being typed, much less the odds against you reading it were inconceivable.
sentences.chinese: 打出這句子的勝算比被這句子你所讀是不可理解的。

sentences.english: There are still enough doubts about Obama to allow McCain to win.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬還是有足夠的疑問，多到讓麥凱恩還有勝算。

sentences.english: Have you ever been in a no win situation?
sentences.chinese: 你有沒有經歷過一種毫無勝算的局面？

sentences.english: Counting on Chinese consumers, however, may not be a sure bet.
sentences.chinese: 然而，寄希望於國內消費者也許是個勝算難說的賭局。
我們正處在一個毫無勝算的情形。

sentences.english: So what are Johnson's odds at JCPenney?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，約翰遜在JCPenney有多少勝算？

sentences.english: Every part of me is blessed with elegance. A low-level spirit like you has no chance of winning.
sentences.chinese: 我的一切受優雅所祝福，像妳這樣的低等靈毫無勝算。

sentences.english: And exactly how much share does News Corp hold in the search engine news v. old-guard media battle?
sentences.chinese: 新聞集團在新老媒體之爭中的勝算幾何呢？

sentences.english: I think you have fifty percent of odds-on to reach your destination.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲，貴司在這個問題上有百分之五十的勝算。

sentences.english: Perhaps you’re in a ‘no win situation’ right now.
sentences.chinese: 也許你正處在一個毫無勝算的景況當中。

sentences.english: There are many things you can do to improve your success against bear form.
sentences.chinese: 又很多事情可以提高你對熊德德勝算。

definition: to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
inferior/disadvantaged
to start a war/to make war/to battle against
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
to turn a blind eye to
to assert/assertion
to defeat/to smash/to rout
probability/odds (Tw)
powerful enemy
battle line/battlefront/front
tactics
a shout/fig. opinion or demand, esp. expressed by a group
the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign
destructive power/harmfulness
sweet taste (of power, success etc)/benefit
